title: Quiz 5: Control of Vectors and Pests
description: Evaluate your understanding of disease vectors, transmission modes, and effective control measures.

questions.question: Which mosquito species is responsible for transmitting Malaria?
questions.explanation: The female Anopheles mosquito transmits the plasmodium parasite causing malaria.

questions.question: The transmission mode where the pathogen undergoes development inside the vector is called ___BLANK___ transmission.
questions.explanation: Biological transmission implies that the pathogen multiplies or develops within the vector's body before transmission.

questions.question: Match the vector with the disease it transmits:
questions.explanation: Tsetse->Sleeping Sickness; Flea->Plague; Lice->Relapsing Fever; Mites->Scabies.
questions.hint: Think about historical plagues for flea.

questions.question: Which of the following are effective environmental measures for controlling mosquitoes? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Environmental control focuses on removing breeding sites (water, vegetation). Nail hygiene is for personal health.

questions.question: What is the term for an organism, usually an insect, which transmits a pathogen from a source of infection to a susceptible host?
questions.explanation: A vector acts as a carrier for disease-causing organisms.

questions.question: Mechanical transmission involves the pathogen developing inside the vector.
questions.explanation: False. Mechanical transmission involves the vector physically carrying the pathogen on its body/legs without development.
questions.hint: Think of a taxi carrying a passenger.

questions.question: Which rodent-borne disease is transmitted through food contaminated with urine or faeces?
questions.explanation: Salmonellosis is transmitted via food contaminated by infected rodent excreta.

questions.question: Arrange the hierarchy of control methods from most effective (Source Reduction) to least sustainable:
questions.explanation: Eliminating the breeding site is permanent. Barriers are next best. Chemical control is temporary.

questions.question: Which chemical is commonly used to kill bed bugs and white ants in cracks and crevices?
questions.explanation: Kerosene is a cheap and effective household chemical used to kill bed bugs in furniture crevices.
